Tahitlian: Ua ite oe i te parau Marite? (oo-ah ee-tay oh-ay eetay pah- rah-oo mah-ree-tay)
Aita i papu ia’u. (eye-tah ee pah-poo ee-ah-oo)
Faa taere te parau. (fah-ah tah-ay-ray tay pah-rah-oo)
O vai to oe i’oa? (oh vah-ee toh oh-ay ee-oh-ah)
O Joan to’u i’oa. (oh John toh-oo ee-oh-ah)
No te Fenua Marite mai vau. (noh tay feh-noo-ahmah-ree-tay my vah-oo)
Fa’aite mai ia’u ite e’a ... (fah-eye-tay my ee-ah-ooee-tay ay-ah)
Na te pae atau. (nah tay pah-ay ah-tah-oo)
Na te pae aui. (nah tay pah-ay ah-wee)
Hina’aro vau e parau ia John. (hee-nah-ah-roh vah-oo ay pah-rah-oo ee-ah John)
English: I want to speak to John.
What is the name of this?
What is the price of this?

Tahitlian: E mea maita’ i roa teie. (ay may-ah my-tie roh-ahtay-ee-ay)
Hina’aro oe e inu? (hee-nah-ah-roh oh-ay ay ee-noo)
Ua poia anei oe? (oo-ah poh-ee-ah ah-nay-ee oh-ay)
